incidents.title: Laptop Not Powering On
incidents.description: User reports laptop will not turn on despite being plugged in. Power LED is not illuminating.
incidents.resolution: 1. Check power adapter connection and outlet. 2. Try a different power adapter if available. 3. Perform a hard reset by holding power button for 15 seconds. 4. If issue persists, submit hardware replacement request.

incidents.title: Printer Not Printing
incidents.description: Network printer is showing as offline and not accepting print jobs from any workstation.
incidents.resolution: 1. Check printer power and network cable connections. 2. Restart the printer. 3. Verify printer IP address matches network configuration. 4. Clear print queue and restart print spooler service. 5. Reinstall printer drivers if needed.

incidents.title: Monitor Display Issues
incidents.description: External monitor showing flickering display or no signal detected message.
incidents.resolution: 1. Check cable connections (HDMI/DisplayPort/VGA). 2. Try a different cable. 3. Update display drivers. 4. Test with another monitor to isolate issue. 5. Check display settings in OS.

incidents.title: Application Crash on Startup
incidents.description: Business application crashes immediately upon launch with error code 0x80004005.
incidents.resolution: 1. Clear application cache and temporary files. 2. Run application as administrator. 3. Check for pending Windows updates. 4. Repair or reinstall the application. 5. Check Event Viewer for detailed error logs.

incidents.title: Microsoft Office License Activation
incidents.description: Microsoft Office showing unlicensed product warning and limited functionality.
incidents.resolution: 1. Sign out and sign back into Microsoft account. 2. Run Office activation troubleshooter. 3. Verify license assignment in admin portal. 4. Use command: cscript ospp.vbs /act to force activation. 5. Contact IT for license reassignment if needed.

incidents.title: Browser Performance Issues
incidents.description: Web browser running slowly, pages taking long time to load, frequent freezing.
incidents.resolution: 1. Clear browser cache and cookies. 2. Disable unnecessary extensions. 3. Check for browser updates. 4. Reset browser to default settings. 5. Scan for malware. 6. Consider using a different browser.

incidents.title: Password Reset Request
incidents.description: User has forgotten password and cannot access their account.
incidents.resolution: 1. Verify user identity through security questions or manager approval. 2. Reset password in Active Directory. 3. Set temporary password and require change on next login. 4. Ensure user can access email for password reset link if using self-service.

incidents.title: Account Lockout
incidents.description: User account locked due to multiple failed login attempts.
incidents.resolution: 1. Verify user identity. 2. Check for any suspicious login attempts in security logs. 3. Unlock account in Active Directory. 4. Reset password if compromise suspected. 5. Check for cached credentials on other devices.

incidents.title: New Employee Account Setup
incidents.description: Request to create accounts and access for new employee starting.
incidents.resolution: 1. Create Active Directory account with appropriate group memberships. 2. Set up email account in Exchange/M365. 3. Provision access to required applications. 4. Create VPN credentials if remote access needed. 5. Document all access granted.

incidents.title: VPN Connection Failed
incidents.description: Unable to establish VPN connection to corporate network from remote location.
incidents.resolution: 1. Verify internet connectivity. 2. Check VPN client is updated to latest version. 3. Ensure correct VPN profile is selected. 4. Try connecting to different VPN server. 5. Check if firewall is blocking VPN ports. 6. Restart VPN service.

incidents.title: WiFi Connectivity Issues
incidents.description: Unable to connect to corporate WiFi network or experiencing frequent disconnections.
incidents.resolution: 1. Forget and reconnect to WiFi network. 2. Restart wireless adapter. 3. Update WiFi drivers. 4. Check if MAC address is registered for network access. 5. Move closer to access point. 6. Try connecting to guest network to isolate issue.

incidents.title: Email Not Syncing
incidents.description: Outlook not receiving new emails or showing sync errors with Exchange server.
incidents.resolution: 1. Check internet connectivity. 2. Verify Outlook is in online mode. 3. Repair Outlook profile. 4. Clear Outlook cache. 5. Check Exchange server status. 6. Recreate email profile if issue persists.

incidents.title: Phishing Email Reported
incidents.description: User received suspicious email requesting credentials or containing suspicious links.
incidents.resolution: 1. Do not click any links or download attachments. 2. Report email using phishing report button. 3. Forward email to security team for analysis. 4. Delete email from inbox and deleted items. 5. If credentials were entered, immediately change password and enable MFA.

incidents.title: Malware Detection Alert
incidents.description: Antivirus software detected potential malware or suspicious file on workstation.
incidents.resolution: 1. Disconnect from network immediately. 2. Run full antivirus scan. 3. Quarantine or remove detected threats. 4. Check for any data exfiltration. 5. Update antivirus definitions. 6. Report to security team for investigation.

incidents.title: Unauthorized Access Attempt
incidents.description: Security alert showing login attempts from unusual location or device.
incidents.resolution: 1. Verify if access attempt was legitimate with user. 2. If unauthorized, immediately reset password. 3. Enable or verify MFA is active. 4. Review recent account activity. 5. Check for any data access or changes. 6. Document incident for security audit.

incidents.title: Keyboard or Mouse Not Working
incidents.description: USB keyboard or mouse not responding or intermittently disconnecting.
incidents.resolution: 1. Try different USB port. 2. Check for physical damage to cable. 3. Test with another keyboard/mouse. 4. Update USB drivers. 5. Check Device Manager for errors. 6. For wireless devices, replace batteries and re-pair.

incidents.title: Software Installation Request
incidents.description: User needs specific software installed that requires admin privileges.
incidents.resolution: 1. Verify software is on approved list. 2. Check license availability. 3. Use software deployment tool or remote install. 4. If not approved, submit software request for review. 5. Document installation and license assignment.

incidents.title: Slow Network Performance
incidents.description: Network speeds significantly slower than normal, affecting productivity.
incidents.resolution: 1. Run speed test to measure current bandwidth. 2. Check for bandwidth-heavy applications. 3. Restart network equipment. 4. Check for network congestion. 5. Verify QoS settings. 6. Contact ISP if external connectivity issue.

troubleshooting_guides.title: Basic Computer Troubleshooting
troubleshooting_guides.description: General steps for common computer issues: 1. Restart the computer. 2. Check all cable connections. 3. Run Windows Update. 4. Check disk space. 5. Run antivirus scan. 6. Check Event Viewer for errors.

troubleshooting_guides.title: Network Connectivity Troubleshooting
troubleshooting_guides.description: Steps to diagnose network issues: 1. Check physical connections. 2. Run ipconfig /all to verify IP settings. 3. Ping gateway and DNS servers. 4. Run network troubleshooter. 5. Reset TCP/IP stack with netsh commands.

troubleshooting_guides.title: Email Troubleshooting Guide
troubleshooting_guides.description: Common email fixes: 1. Check internet connection. 2. Verify email credentials. 3. Check server settings (IMAP/SMTP). 4. Clear email cache. 5. Repair email profile. 6. Check mailbox quota.
